e4: I recommend changing to the new policy to align earnings reports with true performance, thereby enhancing trust and maintaining the ethical integrity of the company’s financial reporting. Additionally, it steers clear of potential legal and reputational risks associated with biased reporting and benefits all investors with clear and accurate information.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should provide accurate, unbiased, and transparent financial information, ensuring it reflects true company performance without intentionally obfuscating data. It must comply with legal standards, safeguarding investor interests across sophistication levels, prevent information asymmetry exploitation, and align with a general responsibility to uphold fiduciary duties to all stakeholders involved.
e6: Yes, questions include: What measures will be taken to ensure all investors fully comprehend this policy change? How can we mitigate potential market misinterpretations during the transition? What strategic processes will be put in place to estimate the new policy’s expected impact on share price? Have other compliance concerns beyond perceived bias been identified? How can we support retail investors adapting?
